name: biopieces

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
The Biopieces are a collection of bioinformatics tools that can be
pieced together in a very easy and flexible manner to perform both
simple and complex tasks.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: perl-module-build
dependencies.description:
Module::Build is a system for building, testing, and installing Perl
modules. It is meant to be an alternative to ExtUtils::MakeMaker.
Developers may alter the behavior of the module through subclassing in a
much more straightforward way than with MakeMaker. It also does not
require a make on your system - most of the Module::Build code is pure-
perl and written in a very cross-platform way.

dependencies.name: perl-bit-vector
dependencies.description: Efficient bit vector, set of integers and "big int" math library

dependencies.name: perl-svg
dependencies.description: Perl extension for generating Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) documents.

dependencies.name: perl-termreadkey
dependencies.description:
Term::ReadKey is a compiled perl module dedicated to providing simple
control over terminal driver modes (cbreak, raw, cooked, etc.,) support
for non-blocking reads, if the architecture allows, and some generalized
handy functions for working with terminals. One of the main goals is to
have the functions as portable as possible, so you can just plug in "use
Term::ReadKey" on any architecture and have a good likelihood of it
working.

dependencies.name: perl-time-hires
dependencies.description: High resolution alarm, sleep, gettimeofday, interval timers

dependencies.name: perl-dbi
dependencies.description:
The DBI is the standard database interface module for Perl. It defines a
set of methods, variables and conventions that provide a consistent
database interface independent of the actual database being used.

dependencies.name: perl-xml-parser
dependencies.description: XML::Parser - A perl module for parsing XML documents

dependencies.name: perl-carp-clan
dependencies.description: Report errors from perspective of caller of a "clan" of modules

dependencies.name: perl-class-inspector
dependencies.description: Get information about a class and its structure

dependencies.name: perl-html-parser
dependencies.description: HTML parser class

dependencies.name: perl-libwww-perl
dependencies.description:
The libwww-perl collection is a set of Perl modules which provides a
simple and consistent application programming interface to the World-
Wide Web. The main focus of the library is to provide classes and
functions that allow you to write WWW clients.

dependencies.name: perl-soap-lite
dependencies.description: Perl's Web Services Toolkit

dependencies.name: perl-uri
dependencies.description: Uniform Resource Identifiers (absolute and relative)

dependencies.name: perl-inline
dependencies.description: Write Perl Subroutines in Other Programming Languages

dependencies.name: perl-inline-c
dependencies.description: C Language Support for Inline

dependencies.name: perl-parse-recdescent
dependencies.description: Generate Recursive-Descent Parsers

dependencies.name: perl-perl-version
dependencies.description: Parse and manipulate Perl version strings

dependencies.name: perl-db-file
dependencies.description:
DB_File is a module which allows Perl programs to make use of the
facilities provided by Berkeley DB version 1.x (if you have a newer
version of DB, see "Using DB_File with Berkeley DB version 2 or
greater"). It is assumed that you have a copy of the Berkeley DB manual
pages at hand when reading this documentation. The interface defined
here mirrors the Berkeley DB interface closely.

dependencies.name: perl-dbd-mysql
dependencies.description: MySQL driver for the Perl5 Database Interface (DBI)

dependencies.name: ruby
dependencies.description:
A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity
and productivity.

dependencies.name: ruby-gnuplot
dependencies.description: Utility library to aid in interacting with gnuplot from ruby

dependencies.name: ruby-narray
dependencies.description:
Numo::NArray is an Numerical N-dimensional Array class for fast
processing and easy manipulation of multi-dimensional numerical data,
similar to numpy.ndaray.

dependencies.name: ruby-rubyinline
dependencies.description: Inline allows you to write foreign code within your ruby code.

dependencies.name: ruby-terminal-table
dependencies.description: Simple, feature rich ascii table generation library

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: blast-plus
dependencies.description: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool.

dependencies.name: muscle
dependencies.description:
MUSCLE is one of the best-performing multiple alignment programs
according to published benchmark tests, with accuracy and speed that are
consistently better than CLUSTALW.

dependencies.name: mummer
dependencies.description: MUMmer is a system for rapidly aligning entire genomes.

dependencies.name: blat
dependencies.description:
BLAT (BLAST-like alignment tool) is a pairwise sequence alignment
algorithm.

dependencies.name: vmatch
dependencies.description:
Vmatch is a versatile software tool for efficiently solving large scale
sequence matching tasks

dependencies.name: bowtie
dependencies.description:
Bowtie is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner for short
DNA sequences (reads) from next-gen sequencers.

dependencies.name: bwa
dependencies.description: Burrow-Wheeler Aligner for pairwise alignment between DNA sequences.

dependencies.name: usearch
dependencies.description:
USEARCH is a unique sequence analysis tool with thousands of users
world-wide. Note: A manual download is required for USEARCH. Spack will
search your current directory for the download file. Alternatively, add
this file to a mirror so that Spack can find it. For instructions on how
to set up a mirror, see
https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html

dependencies.name: velvet
dependencies.description:
Velvet is a de novo genomic assembler specially designed for short read
sequencing technologies.

dependencies.name: idba
dependencies.description:
IDBA is a practical iterative De Bruijn Graph De Novo Assembler for
sequence assembly in bioinfomatics.

dependencies.name: ray
dependencies.description: Parallel genome assemblies for parallel DNA sequencing

dependencies.name: scan-for-matches
dependencies.description:
scan_for_matches is a utility written in C for locating patterns in DNA
or protein FASTA files.
